reviews.text: We stayed here for several days at the end of April and were completely disappointed with this hotel. We had much higher expectations judging from the website and reviews. I asked for another room and was told I would be happy in the room we were in, I wasn't. We would have paid more for a better room but were told this was the only one available, even though it was obvious the property was not even close to full. The property seems neglected with standing water, ashtrays filled with the same gum balls and used bandaids by the pool for days, leaves and debris in the paths. Our room was dark, the partial ocean view was available if you stood on porch and leaned out. The porch was separated from the road by a thin line of trees and it was very loud with buses, trucks & cars all day and all night. We had hoped to hear birds in the early morning like everywhere else we stayed in Costa Rica, instead we heard traffic and a generator that was also pretty darn loud. We ran the air conditioner in the room at night to drown out the noise so we could get some sleep. It was a window unit and also pretty loud. There was a giant TV in the room that we didn't use. The bed seemed to have sand in it no matter what we did. One day we asked to have the room cleaned when we went out, we came back 2 hours later and it still wasn't cleaned. We called again and still 2 more hours and it wasn't cleaned. We had wanted to take a nap but by the time our room was cleaned it was too late in the day.
reviews.title: Wish we'd stayed elsewhere

reviews.text: There is a lot of walking on this property and it's all very spread out. If you walk around at night you can see in many rooms if the curtains aren't pulled so there is a lack of privacy, depending on what room you have.
reviews.title: Definitely more monkeys than people! AWESOME!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They tried to kick us out of the pool the first night we were there saying it was closed at 8pm even though the literature says open til 10pm. They relented and let us stay when we pointed this out. The literature also says the internet would be available til 10pm but it isn't. It's available til 8pm in the gift shops, they changed their hours but you can go across the street to the trailer. It's $4 an hour to use the internet and that always seemed to wind up being around 50 minutes.
reviews.title: Some positives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw a lot of animals in the parking lot behind the hotel..monkeys, lizards etc. but only lizards near our rooms.
reviews.title: Lots of animals- more monkeys and lizards than people

reviews.text: We ate across the street at the BBQ place, we didn't like it even though we had high expectations with the live band and flames shooting out of the grill by the side of road. It wasn't terrible but the food was not that good and we were bitten by bugs through the meal. They gave us some spray, which helped.
reviews.title: Not Bad. Not Great.

reviews.text: This hotel is very over rated! The rooms were run down- the traffic was loud. They get business because of the white faced monkeys while you dine there/ other than that the hotel leaves much to be desired.
reviews.title: Way over rated/much nicer hotels in area

reviews.text: We had an absolute blast at Costa Verde. When we booked the rooms we were a little worried because they only had 2 rooms left, and they told us that the rooms were right below the kitchen.(that opens at 6:00 am) But the rooms were great. No extra noise at all. We had a view of the ocean. We also had all the same amenities as all the other rooms. You kinda have to understand that you are staying in an area that frequently looses power. You may have extremely HOT water or extremely COLD water. That is all over Costa Rica. Please don't start yelling at the staff if the water temp is not 100% perfect. As they say don't sweat the small stuff, your in paradise.
reviews.title: Had a Blast at Costa Verde

reviews.text: We were also super happy with the service not only in the restaurants but at the front desk. The guys/gals that work the front desk are very helpful and will book trips for you as well as whatever you need. ( However they take a fee for this usually about $20.00 a person for the excursions) This hotel also has a pool that is for 18 years and up. That is an added bonus for all the young adults that don't want to spend their vacation surrounded by "excited" kids.
reviews.title: familys with children under 18 avoid this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw lots of wildlife at Costa Verde. The monkeys run by the adult pool most afternoons in a groups of about 5 to 10. If you want to see a sloth I recommend just sitting really still and scanning the trees. If you hear a branch crack or see leaves falling head over to that tree and stare at it. Really stare. They blend in very well. What you might think is just a knot in the tree usually turns out to be a sloth. We saw about six on the Costa Verde property. You will also see a lot of lizards. They are pretty much everywhere. Our friends that were with us saw one in a tree about 10 feet long, (they got a great picture but you can't really tell how BIG it really was).
reviews.title: Great Views and Experience, Needed a Little More Privacy

likes.liked: — The incredible views, proximity to the beach.
likes.disliked: — Rooms have no sound barrier, so you can hear everything that is said next door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can ask the front desk for a ride to El Avion, it is more commonly known as "the airplane bar". We had drinks and dinner here. Both were great but a little on the expensive side. I recommend going here for a cocktail around sunset and a light snack. This is a great place to see sunset. We also took in sunset at Ronnie's place. This was also a great sunset spot, and the Sangaria is pretty refreshing after a long day in the sun.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!

reviews.text: This hotel was great - amazing views, lush grounds, good food, and comfy rooms. We enjoyed seeing monkeys, a sloth, and lizards on the grounds. We loved the pool at Costa Verde II - it was so much fun to swim, take in the views, and then have lunch right on the spot. The prices are also really reasonable if you have 4 people (2 couples) sharing a studio with two beds. We chose to stay in the regular studios and not at Costa Verde II because we wanted air conditioning, and this was a wise decision because it was HOT! The staff was friendly and helpful, answering questions promptly and thoroughly both on email and in person. Lastly, the proximity to the beach was awesome - a quick 5-minute drive or $6 cab ride.
reviews.title: We loved Costa Verde and want to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only drawback - our room could have used hand towels!
reviews.title: Best Vacation EVER!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Costa Rica and we really didn't know what to expect other than what we had researched on the internet. We couldn't wait to leave San Jose and the Interbus transfer was a decent way to travel without flying into Quepos.
reviews.title: what a view!

reviews.text: When we made it to Costa Verde, where we spent 6 days, and it was absolutely beautiful. We were given the perfect room, we thought, B4, in the B building. We had opted for this area, although this wasn't the adults only area, but it had air conditioning and tv. We had a perfect view of the jungle as well as the ocean from our deck. The pool in our area was secluded in a jungle setting and most of the time we had it all to ourselves. The kids that were there we very well behaved and didn't usually stay long as I'm sure they had other activities in the area to visit. The pool was a little scummy and the water not as refreshing as the adult pool, but we liked the seclusion of it. We were visited by a few monkeys, but they moved on and just hung out in the trees. There were plenty of monkeys that would come out early in the mornings around our room and we got tons of great pictures.
reviews.title: Can't wait to get back!

reviews.text: The adult pool was a short walk (we didn't rent a car) but the exercise won't hurt anyone, right? My husband has some disabilities, so it was slow going, but everyone was very accommodating and patient with him. The adult pool is great in the late afternoon to have a drink and watch the beautiful sunsets. And the water was absolutely perfect!! The resident Iguana's are fun to watch and one stole a banana off the side of my glass and seemed to enjoy it immensely.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: Costa Verde was a wonderful hotel. There were five of us in our 30's traveling to Costa Rica. We spent the first half of our trip in Manuel Antonio and the second half we spent in Monteczuma. We reneted the Villa at Costa Verde and stayed for 5 or 6 nights. The views were amazing and the staff (some) were very friendly and offered great service.
reviews.title: Hope to Visit Again Soon

reviews.text: If you are hoping for a Ritz or a Marriott this is not the place for you. This hotel does a great job of making you feel like you are in the jungle. White faced monkeys would swing around our room and howler monkeys might wake you up in the middle of the night and iguanas liked to lounge next to you at the pool. You should also be prepared to hike a lot. We didn't mind as we were all excited to visit and see as much as we could.
reviews.title: Wonderful view of Ocean, Jungle and wildlife at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are without a doubt on the side of a mountain and it is a very steep walk to the beach down a windy road with buses traveling a bit fast. But it was without a doubt a great low key vacation setting. It is not for those who want room service and manicures.
reviews.title: Great Time at Hotel Costa Verde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope we will get back there someday. It was spectacular! Just what we were looking for. A rustic villa in the jugle close to a beach and away from cell phones and internet. (there is internet service in the business center).
reviews.title: No charm here

likes.liked: — The veiw from the pool was nice as it overlooked the ocean, but no shade.
likes.disliked: — The total absense of serenity and charm.

reviews.text: We just returned from a stay at Costa Verde (2 nights) and it seems, from previous reviewers, that we lucked out! We had a room in the B building with a spectacular view of Manuel Antonio and the ocean. The room was decorated Costa Rican beach style and very nice (certainly not on par with luxury hotels by any means but we were not paying for or expecting a luxury hotel.)One large King bed and one double. We traveled with our three children (under 18) and they had loved the hotel. We enjoyed (maybe) the whitefaced monkeys that traveled to the hotel at 6:30 am to hang out on the balconies and try to take whatever maybe on the rail... They were a show. I imagine that they come there to find whatever food (bananas) has been left out from so-called unknowing travelers. We saw a huge... I mean huge iguana in the tree by the family pool on afternoon. The hotel is on a large piece of property and is unique (including an airplane overlooking the jungle and ocean as a large suite.) We dined at the Anaconda for breakfast and had dinner once at La Cantina BBQ across the street. Pretty good BBQ and wonderful Salsa music that we all enjoyed dancing to. El Avion is up the road and a nice sunset. The airplane is an interesting story and the kids loved it. Although the hotel is right on the road to the beach and you do hear cars, buses and trucks, we really didn't spend to much of our day at the hotel. There is just too much to do in MA. The National Park is amazing. We went to the park 2 different days. Our first day in the afternoon with a private guide, Juan Brenes (find him in the forums on Trip Advisor.) He was excellent and we saw amazing animals. Then on our own at 8am to the third beach ~ perfect! We also explore the beach near Parador. It was pretty and you can view the 'private' beach of Tulemar/Buena Vista but it was rocky at low tide. You see a few tours stop here for snorkeling but I am not sure that they see vey much. We enjoyed our stay in Manuel Antonio and loved our room and the people at Costa Verde. I am not sure that I would have like it as much if we didn't have the room that we had in the B building....but we did and we had a great experience and time!
reviews.title: Fantastic view – perfect hotel for couples without kids!
